intro: Verbesina durangensis, commonly known as the Durango beggar's ticks, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in arid regions. It has small, alternate leaves and produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
